trans-unit.source: Using the Chatter Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the Chatter Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the Chatter Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the Chatter Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the Chatter Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the Chatter Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Connect to Chatter and post a message or search a feed.
trans-unit.target: Connect to Chatter and post a message or search a feed.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can search a Chatter feed and when you find something specific, you can post that Chatter message to a Sales group.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can search a Chatter feed and when you find something specific, you can post that Chatter message to a Sales group.

trans-unit.source: You can add the Chatter connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the Chatter connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Triggers and Actions
trans-unit.target: Triggers and Actions

trans-unit.source: A Trigger starts a new instance based on a specific event, like the arrival of a new Chatter message.
trans-unit.target: A Trigger starts a new instance based on a specific event, like the arrival of a new Chatter message.

trans-unit.source: An Action is the result, like after receiving a new Chatter message, then post the message to another Chatter group, or another social media site, like Facebook or Twitter.
trans-unit.target: An Action is the result, like after receiving a new Chatter message, then post the message to another Chatter group, or another social media site, like Facebook or Twitter.

trans-unit.source: The Chatter Connector can be used as a trigger or an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.
trans-unit.target: The Chatter Connector can be used as a trigger or an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.

trans-unit.source: The Chatter connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:
trans-unit.target: The Chatter connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:

trans-unit.source: Triggers
trans-unit.target: Triggers

trans-unit.source: Actions
trans-unit.target: Actions

trans-unit.source: New Message
trans-unit.target: New Message

trans-unit.source: Post Message
trans-unit.target: Post Message

trans-unit.source: Search
trans-unit.target: Search

trans-unit.source: Create the Chatter connector for your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Create the Chatter connector for your Logic App

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.

trans-unit.source: Search for “Chatter Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Search for “Chatter Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties:
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties:

trans-unit.source: **Location** - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed
trans-unit.target: **Location** - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed

trans-unit.source: **Subscription** - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in
trans-unit.target: **Subscription** - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in

trans-unit.source: **Resource group** - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside
trans-unit.target: **Resource group** - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside

trans-unit.source: **Web hosting plan** - select or create a web hosting plan
trans-unit.target: **Web hosting plan** - select or create a web hosting plan

trans-unit.source: **Pricing tier** - choose a pricing tier for the connector
trans-unit.target: **Pricing tier** - choose a pricing tier for the connector

trans-unit.source: **Name** - give a name for your Chatter Connector
trans-unit.target: **Name** - give a name for your Chatter Connector

trans-unit.source: Select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Using the Chatter Connector in your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Using the Chatter Connector in your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Chatter connector as a trigger or action in your Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Chatter connector as a trigger or action in your Logic App.

trans-unit.source: To do this:
trans-unit.target: To do this:

trans-unit.source: In your logic app, open **Triggers and Actions** to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow.
trans-unit.target: In your logic app, open **Triggers and Actions** to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow.

trans-unit.source: The Chatter connector is listed in the gallery:
trans-unit.target: The Chatter connector is listed in the gallery:

trans-unit.source: Select the Chatter connector to automatically add in the designer.
trans-unit.target: Select the Chatter connector to automatically add in the designer.

trans-unit.source: Select **Authorize**, enter your credentials, and select **Allow**:
trans-unit.target: Select **Authorize**, enter your credentials, and select **Allow**:

trans-unit.source: You can now use Chatter connector in the flow.
trans-unit.target: You can now use Chatter connector in the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can use the new message retrieved from the Chatter trigger ("New Message") in other actions in the flow.
trans-unit.target: You can use the new message retrieved from the Chatter trigger ("New Message") in other actions in the flow.

trans-unit.source: Configure the input properties for the Chatter trigger as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the input properties for the Chatter trigger as follows:

trans-unit.source: **Group ID** - Enter the ID of the group from which new message should be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: **Group ID** - Enter the ID of the group from which new message should be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: If Group ID is not provided, then new message is retrieved from the User’s Feed:
trans-unit.target: If Group ID is not provided, then new message is retrieved from the User’s Feed:

trans-unit.source: In the similar way you can use the Chatter action in the flow to post a message by selecting "Post Message" action.
trans-unit.target: In the similar way you can use the Chatter action in the flow to post a message by selecting "Post Message" action.

trans-unit.source: Configure the input properties for "Post Message" action as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the input properties for "Post Message" action as follows:

trans-unit.source: - **Message Text** - Text content of the message to be posted
trans-unit.target: - **Message Text** - Text content of the message to be posted

trans-unit.source: - **Group ID** - Specify the ID of the group to which new message should be posted.
trans-unit.target: - **Group ID** - Specify the ID of the group to which new message should be posted.

trans-unit.source: If group ID is not provided, the message will be posted to user’s feed.
trans-unit.target: If group ID is not provided, the message will be posted to user’s feed.

trans-unit.source: - **File Name** - Name of the file to be attached with this message
trans-unit.target: - **File Name** - Name of the file to be attached with this message

trans-unit.source: - **Content Data** - Content Data of the attachment
trans-unit.target: - **Content Data** - Content Data of the attachment

trans-unit.source: - **Content Type** - Content Type of the Attachment
trans-unit.target: - **Content Type** - Content Type of the Attachment

trans-unit.source: - **Content Transfer Encoding** - Content Transfer Encoding of the attachment (“none”|”base64”)
trans-unit.target: - **Content Transfer Encoding** - Content Transfer Encoding of the attachment (“none”|”base64”)

trans-unit.source: - **Mentions** - Array of user names to be tagged in this message
trans-unit.target: - **Mentions** - Array of user names to be tagged in this message

trans-unit.source: - **Hashtags** - Array of hashtags to be posted along the message
trans-unit.target: - **Hashtags** - Array of hashtags to be posted along the message

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
